Resignation of Andriy Yermak, Zelensky's right-hand man, shocks Ukrainian politics
subhead: The all-powerful head of the presidential administration was deeply unpopular in Ukraine. Yet his departure comes at the worst time, as Kyiv faces mounting pressure from the US to strike a peace deal with Russia.

Trump says Venezuela airspace should be considered 'closed in its entirety'
subhead: The US administration is piling pressure on Venezuela with a major military deployment in the Caribbean. Washington says the aim is to curb drug trafficking, but Caracas insists regime change is the ultimate goal.

title: Bedbugs force closure of prestigious Paris cinema
subhead: The Cinémathèque Française, a renowned film archive and cinema, said it would temporarily close its four screening halls for a month from Friday after a series of reported bedbug sightings.

title: Inside the archives of shoemaker Roger Vivier
subhead: This star shoemaker of the 1930s through the 1990s spent his long career experimenting with all kinds of designs. His archives, a testament to his boundless creativity, are now housed in a Parisian hôtel particulier.

title: Gay Talese, the last titan of the American press
subhead: He was a pioneer of New Journalism, a movement that transformed American journalism with a literary writing style. At 93, the author of the landmark 1966 profile 'Frank Sinatra Has a Cold,' finds his daily life increasingly constrained by old age.

subhead: Statements by General Fabien Mandon and President Emmanuel Macron's announcements about a voluntary national service have raised questions about a scenario that, until recently, seemed unimaginable.

title: Israel's D9 bulldozer, a tool of destruction in Gaza
subhead: Imported by the dozens from the United States, Israel has redesigned Caterpillar D9 bulldozers to play a dual strategic and political role: protecting soldiers entering Gaza and leveling the enclave.
byline: Elsa Longueville,  Liselotte Mas and  Sinead McCausland

title: Why our old clothes end up in the UAE
subhead: The country has emerged as a leader in sorting secondhand clothing, taking advantage of Europe's inability to process its own stockpiles. This outsourcing comes with clear environmental and social costs.
